isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS GUIDES - ENGINE TEST NOMENCLATURE - INJECTION PUMP TIMING

svcprocinfo.para: There are two ways of testing injection pump timing, static and total or advanced. [A & B Series Engines only w/UTDS Model 100 Fuel Injection Pumps.]

svcsubproc.title: Static Timing --
svcsubproc.para: Static timing is done with the engine stopped -- NOT RUNNING. With the injection pump properly timed to the gear train and the #1 piston at the top of its compression stroke, the timing mark on the vibration damper that is in alignment with the timing pointer (Figure 3.1) will indicate static timing in degrees Before Top Dead Center (BTDC). Static timing is not the same for all engines.

svcsubproc.title: Dynamic/Advanced Timing -
svcsubproc.para: Dynamic/advanced timing measures static timing and the degrees of advance built into the injection pump, if advance exists. This test is performed with the engine running at a specified rpm. A diesel timing light and tachometer is used to perform this test.
